definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: A wise man knows his own limitations.

sentences.chinese: 然而，要有自知之明是困难的。

sentences.english: The People's Liberation Army should recognize its failings and restore its prestige through its own efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我们解放军要有自知之明，要靠自己恢复名誉。

sentences.english: It is valuable to know oneself.
We would admire both his earnestness and his self-aware irony.
sentences.chinese: 我们由衷地钦佩他的认真和有自知之明的讽刺艺术。

sentences.english: If my children are silly I must hope to be always sensible of it.
sentences.chinese: 要是我自己的孩子果真蠢，我决不愿意没有自知之明。

sentences.english: He who is ashamed when hearing others singing his praise is a person who is of self-knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 闻听溢美之词感到羞愧的人最有自知之明。

sentences.english: It erodes self-awareness and self-restraint, and fosters self-indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 它降低了自知之明，消磨了自制力，让人变得放纵。

sentences.english: Self-knowledge is a preface to self-control.
sentences.chinese: 若有自知之明方能自制。

sentences.english: So this profession should be chosen only consciously.
sentences.chinese: 所以这个职业只能靠自知之明来选择。

sentences.english: And we think that you will also know it when you cross it.
sentences.chinese: 当您越过这一范围时，我们认为您也会有自知之明。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to show respect for/to think highly of
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
